meanings.sent1: I made a facsimile of the painting by copying it exactly.
meanings.sent2: The fax machine sent a facsimile of the document to the recipient.
meanings.sent3: My attempt to draw a facsimile of the Mona Lisa ended up looking like a stick figure.
meanings.sent4: The replica of the ancient artifact was a facsimile of the original, down to the smallest detail.
meanings.sent5: The facsimile of the famous sculpture was so precise that it fooled many art experts.

meanings.definition: To make an exact copy or reproduction
meanings.sent1: She decided to facsimile the important document to ensure it was preserved.
meanings.sent2: The artist facsimiled the old photograph to create a new piece of art.
meanings.sent3: I tried to facsimile my friend's drawing, but it turned out looking like a mess.
meanings.sent4: The writer's ability to facsimile emotions into words captivated the readers.
meanings.sent5: The machine was able to facsimile the blueprint with incredible accuracy.
